meta.notes: Mid-handicap left-handed player with left eye dominance; focus on solid fundamentals with mid-iron 7-iron swing.

summary.headline: Solid fundamentals with room to improve power and consistency in the 7-iron full swing.
bullets: Good balanced setup with a strong pivot and posture.
Clubface control is mostly square at impact but occasionally opens.
Swing path tends to be slightly inside-out, promoting a fade tendency.
Low point is sometimes behind the ball, causing thin or fat contact.
Reliability under pressure can improve with better start line control.

strengths: Good left-side pivot through the swing
Consistent clubface rotation for mostly square impact
Eye dominance helps alignment and sight line

priorityFixes.title: Control Low Point of Swing
priorityFixes.detail: Focus on striking the ball before the turf to avoid fat or thin shots by adjusting weight shift and shaft lean.

priorityFixes.title: Improve Swing Path Consistency
priorityFixes.detail: Reduce inside-out swing path to promote straighter ball flights and better start line control.

priorityFixes.title: Increase Power Through Better Sequencing
priorityFixes.detail: Develop smoother transition from backswing to downswing to maximize speed while maintaining control.

powerLeaks: Delayed weight shift reduces power on downswing
Early wrist release blunts clubhead speed
Limited hip turn on the backswing
Casting out the clubhead leading to loss of leverage
Lack of lag through impact zone

checkpoints.label: Setup
checkpoints.note: Good posture with athletic stance and proper ball position for 7-iron.
errors: Ball too far forward causing thin shots
Too much tension in hands and arms
drills: Alignment sticks on ground drill to ensure consistent aim
Mirror check for spine angle and balanced stance
Grip pressure drill: hold club lightly to promote fluidity

checkpoints.label: Backswing Length & Width
checkpoints.note: Adequate length but tends to lose width by bending elbows too much early.
drills: Wall drill to feel wide takeaway
Slow motion swings focusing on elbow bend and width
Pause at top to check position

checkpoints.label: Transition & Downswing
checkpoints.note: Early lower body movement delays proper sequence; leads to casting and loss of power.
drills: Step drill for pivot sequencing
Slow swings focusing on initiating downswing with hips
Impact bag drill to feel lag

checkpoints.label: Clubface Control
checkpoints.note: Usually square at impact but occasionally opens causing fades and pushes.
errors: Grip pressure too tight causing tension
drills: Impact tape feedback to monitor strike pattern
Feet together swings to improve feel of square clubface
Slow swings focusing on forearm rotation timing

checkpoints.label: Swing Path
checkpoints.note: Consistent inside-out path creates fade shape and occasional blocks right.
errors: Standing up too early causing out-to-in path
drills: Gate drill with tees to promote proper club path
Slow swings with path feedback using launch monitor
Wall drill to keep club from going over the top

checkpoints.label: Low Point Control
checkpoints.note: Low point often behind the ball causing fat or thin shots.
errors: Improper weight shift to front foot
Weight too much on trail foot at impact
drills: Divot drill focusing on striking slightly ahead of ball
Feet together swings to improve low point awareness
Step through drill promoting weight shift ahead

checkpoints.label: Start Line Control
checkpoints.note: Start line inconsistent under pressure; needs better path and face control.
drills: Practice shots with alignment sticks and target focus
Slow swings checking clubface position at impact
Visualization routines before each shot

checkpoints.label: Follow-Through & Finish
checkpoints.note: Balanced finish position showing good extension and rotation.
drills: Hold finish pose for 5 seconds
Slow motion swings emphasizing smooth finish
Balance drills on single leg post-impact

checkpoints.label: Tempo & Rhythm
checkpoints.note: Steady tempo that supports repeatability, though power could improve.
drills: Metronome practice at 60 bpm
Counted swing drills (1-2) to build rhythm
Slow swings focusing on sequencing

practicePlan.overview: Over the next 14 days, focus on improving the transition and downswing sequencing along with low point control to reduce fat/thin shots. Incorporate drills that promote better swing path and clubface control for straighter ball flights. Maintain tempo and finish balance as strengths.

days.label: DAYS 1–2: Setup & Alignment
days.detail: Practice posture, grip, and ball position. Use alignment sticks to ensure consistent aim and stance. Perform mirror checks to reinforce athletic setup.

days.label: DAYS 3–5: Backswing Width & Transition
days.detail: Do wall drills to keep the club wide in the backswing. Use step and slow motion drills to feel proper hip initiation and avoid casting in transition.

days.label: DAYS 6–8: Clubface & Path Control
days.detail: Practice impact tape feedback and gate drills to calibrate swing path and face. Use slow swings focusing on forearm rotation timing to lock in clubface control.

days.label: DAYS 9–11: Low Point & Weight Shift
days.detail: Work on divot drills to encourage hitting down on the ball. Step-through drill will help shift weight properly to the front foot by impact.

days.label: DAYS 12–14: Tempo & Reinforcement
days.detail: Practice with a metronome and counted swings to cement tempo. Hold balanced finishes to reinforce extension and control.
